etymologies: late 17th century: from Greek, accusative plural of psoa, interpreted as singular

definitions: each of a pair of large muscles which run from the lumbar spine through the groin on either side and, with the iliacus, flex the hip. A second muscle, the psoas minor, has a similar action but is often absent.
shortDefinitions: each of pair of large muscles which run from lumbar spine through groin on either side and, with iliacus, flex hip
